problems.title: Fix Real-World Audio Problems
problems.intro: Remove background noise and echo while keeping your voice natural. Clean up hiss, hum, clicks, and uneven loudness so your audience can focus on the message.

items.title: Remove Background Noise
items.body: Cut constant hiss, hum, fan, and traffic noise to uncover your voice.

items.title: Reduce Room Echo
items.body: De-reverb recordings from untreated rooms for clearer speech.

items.title: Tame Sibilance & Mouth Noises
items.body: Reduce harsh "s" sounds and lip smacks for a smooth, natural tone.

items.title: Repair Clicks & Pops
items.body: Fix minor clicks and pops without dulling the voice.

items.title: Loudness Leveling for Podcasts
items.body: Make voices more even and easier to listen to over time.

items.title: Keep It Natural
items.body: Balance denoising and clarity to avoid metallic "underwater" artifacts.

howItWorks.title: How It Works (In Plain English)
paragraphs: We use modern speech enhancement to reduce noise and echo while keeping your voice natural and intelligible.
Workflow: upload your file → enhance → preview A/B → download the cleaned track.
Supported formats: MP3, WAV, FLAC, OGG. Recommended size: up to 50MB. No account required.

bestPractices.title: Best Practices for Clearer Recordings
items: Keep a steady mic distance and angle; use a pop filter or windscreen.
Reduce room reflections with soft furnishings.
Avoid clipping; set a healthy input level.
For podcasts, aim around −16 LUFS to keep loudness consistent.
For extreme noise or echo, consider re‑recording or advanced DAW tools.

privacy.title: Privacy & Data Handling
items: Temporary processing for enhancement only.
Your audio isn’t used to train models.
No login required.

items.q: Will denoising make my voice sound metallic?
items.a: We balance noise reduction with intelligibility to keep your voice natural. Extreme noise may still cause artifacts—lighter cleanup or re‑recording can help.
Yes, typical hum and low‑frequency rumble can be reduced effectively.

items.q: How much echo can it reduce?
items.a: Moderate room echo can be improved; very strong reverb may require re‑recording or advanced tools.

items.q: Will it improve very noisy recordings?
items.a: It helps, but extremely low signal‑to‑noise sources are challenging. Capture the best possible audio at the source when you can.

items.q: Is the output podcast‑ready for loudness?
items.a: Results are leveled for comfortable listening. For strict platform specs, double‑check LUFS before publishing.

items.q: What file formats and sizes are supported?
items.a: MP3, WAV, FLAC, OGG; up to 50MB per file.
Processing is temporary and purpose‑only; audio is not used to train models.
Most files enhance in seconds to a couple of minutes, depending on length and network conditions.
The default setting avoids over‑processing. For advanced control, consider a DAW workflow.

items.q: Can I use it for music?
items.a: It’s optimized for speech; light cleanup on music may work, but detailed music restoration is better done in a DAW.
